    bugphyzz

    Bugphyzz is a collection of physiological features about bacteria. We are curating the databases through 3 main methods: webscraping, bulk download from online databases, and manual curation from literature. Mainly this database will be used to analyze microbiome data.

    Definitions

    • physiology: a microbial characteristic that can be measured or observed, that should be mapped to an ontology wherever possible. These are defined in inst/extdata/links.tsv
    • attribute: a possible value for a physiology, that should be mapped to an ontology wherever possible. These are defined in the attribute column of inst/extdata/attributes.tsv
    • attribute value: a possible value for an attribute. Allowable values are defined by the validity column of inst/extdata/attributes.tsv. For categorical attributes (such as “obligately aerobic”), values can be “TRUE” and “FALSE”, for example. For numeric attributes, these can be numeric values.

    Installation

    You can install the development version of bugphyzz with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("waldronlab/bugphyzz")
